compounddef.title: SQUEEZE Remove Singleton Dimensions of an Array

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: This function removes the singleton dimensions of an array. The syntax for its use is y = squeeze(x) where x is a multidimensional array. Generally speaking, if x is of size d1 x 1 x d2 x ..., then squeeze(x) is of size d1 x d2 x ..., i.e., each dimension of x that was singular (size 1) is squeezed out.

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: Here is a many dimensioned, ungainly array, both before and after squeezing;

para.verbatim:
--> x = zeros(1,4,3,1,1,2); --> size(x)
ans = 1 4 3 1 1 2
--> y = squeeze(x); --> size(y)
ans = 4 3 2
